instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7201: What is U7201? U7201 is responsible for the 3.3v and 5v power rails on many devices..
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short on 3.3V rails.
threads.message:
Hi. I have this board that was liquid damaged. <CHIP>U7201</CHIP> was damage and replaced. ISL area was damage and replaced. <TRANSISTOR>Q7260</TRANSISTOR> was welded to the board. All my 3.3V S5, S3 and S0 rails are beeping to ground. I am asking for the best way to troubleshoot this issue before i try on my own and fuck this thing up more. Sometimes I tend to that. LOL.
Thanks in advance.


Diode
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> - 0
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL> - .002
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> - .003

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short on 3.3V rails.
threads.message: Yeah this board is trash, PPBUS got to 3V rails, the end.
